intro: Eriosema andongense, commonly known as the Andong mountain sedge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eriosema andongense is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
